words.definition: If something is absolute, it is total or complete.
words.example: My presentation was an absolute disaster! It was terrible!

words.definition: Alas is a word that people say when something bad happens.
words.example: I looked everywhere for my purse, but alas, I couldn’t find it.

words.definition: If you are attentive, you are careful and you pay attention.
words.example: He is a good student because he is attentive to every detail on his work.

words.definition: A cape is a large cloth that covers one’s back and is tied around the neck.
words.example: The superhero wore a bright red cape.

words.definition: To envision something means to imagine that it may happen in the future.
words.example: I can envision my family living in a big house by the ocean.

words.definition: When something is done evenly, it is done in the same way everywhere.
words.example: The snow was spread evenly across the ground.

words.definition: Folk are ordinary people who are from a certain place or group.
words.example: I grew up with some very nice folk in my hometown.

words.definition: To melt means to change from a solid to a liquid.
words.example: The butter melted in the hot pan.

words.definition: A patch is a small area of something that is different from the rest.
words.example: There was a small patch of green grass in the middle of the desert.

words.definition: Pleasure is a feeling of happiness or enjoyment.
words.example: It was a pleasure to meet you.

words.definition: To pop means to make a short, sharp noise.
words.example: The balloon popped when the needle touched it.

words.definition: A pudding is a sweet food that is eaten after a meal.
words.example: We had chocolate pudding for dessert.

words.definition: A rail is a horizontal bar of metal or wood.
words.example: He held onto the rail while walking down the stairs.

words.definition: A recipe is a set of instructions for cooking a certain food.
words.example: I followed a recipe to make this cake.

words.definition: A role is the part that someone or something plays in a situation.
words.example: The teacher’s role is to help students learn.

words.definition: To shrink means to become smaller in size.
words.example: My shirt shrank in the wash.

words.definition: To soak something means to put it in a liquid for a long time.
words.example: I let the dishes soak in the sink.

words.definition: A spark is a small flash of light or fire.
words.example: The campfire gave off several sparks.

words.definition: A spirit is the part of a person that is not their body.
words.example: She has a very positive spirit.

words.definition: A suit is a set of clothes that are made of the same fabric.
words.example: He wore a black suit to the wedding.
